title: The Investment Management Game: Extending the Scope of the Notion of Core. (arXiv:2302.00608v4 [econ.TH] UPDATED)
abstract: The core is a dominant solution concept in economics and game theory. In this context, the following question arises, ``How versatile is this solution concept?'' We note that within game theory, this notion has been used for profit -- equivalently, cost or utility -- sharing only, in the setting of cooperative game theory.  In this paper, we show a completely different use for this notion: in an {\em investment management game} which is not a cooperative game; it is a game against nature. This game has only one agent who needs to allocate her money among investment firms in such a way that {\em in each of exponentially many future scenarios}, sufficient money is available in the ``right'' firms so she can buy an ``optimal investment'' for that scenario.  Our game is defined on {\em perfect graphs}, since the maximum stable set problem in such graphs is in ${\cal P}$. translated_title: 投资管理游戏：扩展核心概念的范围
translated_abstract: 核心是经济学和博弈论中的主导解决方案概念。在合作博弈理论中，该概念仅适用于利润分配。本文展示了核心概念的一个完全不同的应用：在一个非合作博弈的"投资管理游戏"中。我们研究了一个只有一个代理商的游戏，该代理商需要在众多的未来情景中，将资金分配到正确的投资公司，以便为每个情景购买最佳投资。我们的游戏定义在完美图上，并使用类似于Shapley和Shubik的特征化方法来完全确定该游戏的核心。
tldr: 本文通过一个非合作博弈的投资管理游戏扩展了核心概念的应用，该游戏在完美图上使用类似于Shapley和Shubik的特征化方法来确定核心。
